_header: O Jesu Christ of everlasting sweetness
Subjects: fifteen, O’s of Christ; Christ, fifteen O’s
_description: The Fifteen O’s of Christ — thirty-four stanzas rhyme royal

Longleat30.First Lines:
O Ihesu criste lorde euerlastynge swetnesseOwre verray loue and
                    hele of oure synne…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…And þan graunt me þat eritage at myn endyngwicht
                    þou hast graunted virtuous lyuyng

Plimpton39.Facsimiles:
Plimpton,  George A. 
             The Education of Chaucer: Illustrated from the Schoolbooks in Use in
                his Time.
         London: Oxford University Press, 1935: 38 (Pl. XII).
Plimpton39.Editions:
Plimpton,  George A. 
             The Education of Chaucer: Illustrated from the Schoolbooks in Use in
                his Time.
         London: Oxford University Press, 1935: 39 (first 23 lines only).

HunHM142.First Lines:
…Thow suffrediste passion blessed mot þow beThi feruent
                    loue þat neuer wol cese…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…And þan graunt me þat eritage at myn endyngWhich
                    þou hast graunted to uertuous lyuyngAmen
HunHM142.Editions:
Schulz,  Herbert. C. 
             “Middle English Texts from the ‘Bement’ Manuscript.” 
             Huntington Library Quarterly
         3 (1940): 440-65: 451-2.

TokyoTak4.First Lines:
O Ihesu cryst euerlastynge suetnesseOure verray loue and hele of
                    oure synne…
TokyoTak4.Last Lines:
…To be partynere of that place wer rythfulmenHaue blisfull
                    syght and Ioye euer Amen
TokyoTak4.Note:
First text after Speculum (the MS is unfoliated; this text occurs
                    between the end of Speculum Vitae and table of chapter of
                    same).
TokyoTak4.Attributed Title: The xv Oes in englyssh tonge
